de.mrapp.android.dialog.view

Class DialogRootView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.view.DialogRootView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, AreaListener

    public class DialogRootView
extends android.widget.LinearLayout
implements AreaListener
    The root view of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices. It is used to restrict the maximum height of the dialog on tablets in landscape mode.
    Since:
    3.4.3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DialogRootView.AreaViewType
      Represents a view, which corresponds to an ScrollableArea.Area.
      static class  DialogRootView.DividerLocation
      Contains all possible locations of a divider in relation to the scroll view, which is contained by a dialog.
      static class  DialogRootView.DividerViewType
      Represents a divider.
      static interface  DialogRootView.ViewType
      Defines the interface, a class, which represents a view type of a dialog, must implement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogRootView

        public DialogRootView(@NonNull
                      android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new root view of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • DialogRootView

        public DialogRootView(@NonNull
                      android.content.Context context,
                      @Nullable
                      android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new root view of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained

      • DialogRootView

        public DialogRootView(@NonNull
                      android.content.Context context,
                      @Nullable
                      android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                      @AttrRes
                      int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new root view of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • DialogRootView

        public DialogRootView(@NonNull
                      android.content.Context context,
                      @Nullable
                      android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                      @AttrRes
                      int defaultStyle,
                      @StyleRes
                      int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new root view of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the view, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults
